edu.byu.cc.plieber.fpgaenet.fcp
Class FCPProtocol

java.lang.Object
  edu.byu.cc.plieber.fpgaenet.fcp.FCPProtocol

public class FCPProtocol
extends java.lang.Object

The main class to instantiate for communication of an FCP/UDP/IP connection. Provides methods to send data, request data, and received data. All data is sent and received as byte arrays.

Author:
Peter Lieber

connect

public void connect(java.net.InetAddress address,

Connects to an FPGA at the given address

Parameters:
address - Address (usually derived from IP address)
port - Remote UDP port (0x3001)

connect

public void connect(java.net.InetAddress address)

disconnect

public void disconnect()
Disconnect from FPGA. This method does not send anything to the FPGA, but only ends the send and receiving threads of execution and closes the UDP socket.

getDataResponse

public byte[] getDataResponse()
Gets the response data that has been received due to a data request. Blocks until data is available.

Returns:
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException
